intro: Ferraria macrochlamys, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds.
